items.q: Which card game involves trying to get a hand total as close to 21 as possible without going over?
items.explanation: It is also commonly referred to simply as '21'.

items.q: The video game 'Pac-Man' involves eating dots while running away from colorful ghosts.
items.explanation: It is one of the most recognizable and successful arcade games in history.

items.q: In the game 'Candy Land', players must answer trivia questions to advance on the board.
items.explanation: Candy Land is a simple racing game for young children requiring no reading or trivia, only drawing color cards.

items.q: What word guessing game involves one player thinking of a word while the other tries to guess it before a stick figure is fully drawn?
items.explanation: Each incorrect letter guess adds a body part to the drawing.

items.q: What incredibly popular video game franchise involves catching and training creatures to battle each other, often storing them in small round balls?
items.explanation: The tagline is famously 'Gotta catch 'em all!'.

items.q: What classic family board game requires players to carefully remove rectangular wooden blocks from a tower without letting it fall over?
items.explanation: The game becomes increasingly tense as the tower gets taller and less stable.

items.q: In the classic game 'Uno', what must a player yell when they only have exactly one card left in their hand?
items.explanation: Failing to yell it can result in drawing penalty cards if caught.

items.q: What console created by Microsoft competes directly with Sony's PlayStation?
items.explanation: The original Xbox was released in 2001, featuring games like 'Halo'.

items.q: Which popular sandbox video game lets players build anything out of textured 3D cubes?
items.explanation: It is the best-selling video game of all time.

items.q: What classic Hasbro board game involves investigating a mansion to determine who committed a murder, with what weapon, and in what room?
items.explanation: Famous characters include Miss Scarlet and Colonel Mustard.
